jcr:content.jcr:description: Bezons, 13 January 2017 – Worldline [Euronext : WLN], European leader in the payments and transactional services sector, will reinvent the consumer experience at the NRF (National Retail Federation) Retail’s Big Show from 15th till 17th January 2017.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Worldline will be at the 2017 NRF Retail’s Big Show

richtext.text:
Bezons, 13 January 2017 – Worldline [Euronext : WLN], European leader in the payments and transactional services sector, will reinvent the consumer experience at the NRF (National Retail Federation) Retail’s Big Show from 15th till 17th January 2017.

In partnership with Atos, Dassault Systèmes and SES-imagotag, Worldline will showcase its latest innovations, from 15th till 17th January 2017, at the NRF Retail’s Big Show in New York, retail’s staple global event.

Digital Transformation has drastically altered consumers’ needs and expectations. It is in this particular context that Worldline helps retailers by innovating and reinventing the buying experience of the customers. Worldline will thus present its WL Connected Store at the NRF, a solution that enables retailers to offer a fully digital customer path at the point-of-sale, from catalog browsing to filling their basket and paying for purchases. The new payment terminal VALINA, designed by Worldline, will also be one of the solutions showcased at the event. VALINA is the first Android payment terminal for vending machines. It is natively compatible with all types of ticket-based vending machines currently on the market and can offer new value-added services tied to loyalty programs and coupons.

Lastly, Worldline will also present one of its latest innovations: the Donation Box. This new solution combines a connected box and the contactless payment terminal YONEO. Not only can it enable simple donations, it also enables real-time online tracking of donations. This solution, launched in the offices of Worldline France last December during the Téléthon as part of its Corporate Social Responsibility initiatives, was a great success. At the Retail Big Show, Worldline will this time back BIG against breast cancer, a global non-profit association who is actively involved in breast cancer research and, more particularly its global clinical study “Big time for baby”, which aims to evaluate the relapse risks linked to stopping therapy for up to 2 years for women, suffering from hormone-sensitive breast cancer, who want to pursue their pregnancy dreams. Event attendees will be able, if they wish, to make a micro donation of 3 dollars with their contactless card and their smartphone, which is the equivalent of one patient’s daily costs of participating in this clinical study.  

 


Vincent Roland, Executive Vice President Global Business Line Merchant Services, said: “Retailers have the formidable opportunity to benefit from the Digital Transformation in order to reinvent their customers’ buying experience. Worldline’s solutions, showcased at the NRF, are designed to support retailers in this approach and to digitize their points-of-sales. Of course, we design our solutions in ways that will facilitate the buying experience but not only, as shown by our Donation Box, because we are convinced that electronic payment and digitization can be beneficial for the whole world “



Meet us on booth 4421 (Hall 3) to attend demos of the Worldline solutions and learn how micro donations help associations. Visit our NRF-dedicates mini site to know more.


About Worldline


Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing including equensWorldline. Worldline employs more than 8,600 people worldwide, with estimated revenue of circa 1.5 billion euros on a yearly basis. Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com
